Package com.atakmap.map.formats.quantizedmesh

Interface QMESourceLayer

  • public interface QMESourceLayer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.List<TileExtents> getAvailableExtents​(int level)
      Get a list of TileExtents available to this source layer at the given level.
      int getClosestLevel​(double geodeticSpan)
      Get the closest level that can be provided by the source layer given a geodetic span
      java.io.File getDirectory()
      Obtain the local directory that houses all tiles for the entire source layer.

      Obtain the local directory that houses tiles for the given z level in this source layer.
      int getMaxLevel()
      Get the max level of detail available to the source layer

      Returns the maximum zoom level the source can provide.

      Returns the minimum zoom level the source can provide.

      Obtain the local file location representing the tile for the given x, y, z coordinates in this source layer.

      Check if a tile is available for this layer
      boolean isEnabled()
      Check if this source layer is presently enabled
      boolean isLocalDirectoryValid()
      Indicates if the local storage location exists and appears to be usable
      boolean isValid()
      Check if this layer is valid.
      void startDataRequest​(int x, int y, int z)
      Start an asynchronous data request for the tile at the given x, y, z location.

    • Method Detail

      • getMinZoom

        int getMinZoom()
        Returns the minimum zoom level the source can provide.
        Returns:
        minimum zoom level

      • getMaxZoom

        int getMaxZoom()
        Returns the maximum zoom level the source can provide.
        Returns:
        maximum zoom level

      • isLocalDirectoryValid

        boolean isLocalDirectoryValid()
        Indicates if the local storage location exists and appears to be usable
        Returns:
        true if local storage location exists and appears to be usable, false otherwise

      • getClosestLevel

        int getClosestLevel​(double geodeticSpan)
        Get the closest level that can be provided by the source layer given a geodetic span
        Parameters:
        geodeticSpan - Geodetic span, in degrees
        Returns:
        Closest level to the provided span

      • getMaxLevel

        int getMaxLevel()
        Get the max level of detail available to the source layer
        Returns:
        Maximum LOD

      • getDirectory

        java.io.File getDirectory()
        Obtain the local directory that houses all tiles for the entire source layer.
        Returns:
        the directory for tiles in the source layer

      • getLevelDirectory

        java.io.File getLevelDirectory​(int z)
        Obtain the local directory that houses tiles for the given z level in this source layer. It is expected that the returned directory be somewhere below the location returned by getDirectory().
        Parameters:
        z - the z level to get the directory name for
        Returns:
        the directory for the given level

      • getTileFile

        java.io.File getTileFile​(int x,
                         int y,
                         int z)
        Obtain the local file location representing the tile for the given x, y, z coordinates in this source layer.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the tile to get the local filename for
        y - the y coordinate of the tile to get the local filename for
        z - the z level of the tile to get the local filename for
        Returns:
        the tile file

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        Check if this layer is valid. A backing layer is valid if it has a valid source from which to make requests for tiles to
        Returns:
        True if valid, false otherwise

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Check if this source layer is presently enabled
        Returns:
        true if enabled, false otherwise

      • hasTile

        boolean hasTile​(int x,
                int y,
                int level)
        Check if a tile is available for this layer
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate
        y - Y coordinate
        level - Level
        Returns:
        True if this tile is available

      • getAvailableExtents

        java.util.List<TileExtents> getAvailableExtents​(int level)
        Get a list of TileExtents available to this source layer at the given level.
        Parameters:
        level - the level to query
        Returns:
        list of TileExtents

      • startDataRequest

        void startDataRequest​(int x,
                      int y,
                      int z)
        Start an asynchronous data request for the tile at the given x, y, z location. The Layer implementation will request and populate the tile to the appropriate local file store location (see getTileFilename()).
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        z - level
